page.title: 06WILBERFOSS SPORTS CLUB
page.content: The sports club is one of the centres of social life in the village. It sells the cheapest beer for miles around and has excellent cricket and football facilities. Each year Wilber- foss teams take part in local soccer, cricket and darts leagues. A grounds- man keeps the turf in good order. The pavilion has changing rooms and toilets in one part and has just had an extension added.In the main bar well upholstered seats surround a central area complete with pool table and dancing square. Dart boards and "fruit machines"are provided. In school holiday times films are often shown for the benefit of the children. The best selling drink in the club is bitter beer at 52p per pint and the best selling snack is salted pea- nuts. The pavilion has twice been burgled and money and goods taken.
